rename.from: API for getting/setting whether window is maximized

body: This is one of those issues that needs to be solved for GLFW to be a good choice for tool writers.

issue.title: genesis can't tell whether a window is maximized or not
issue.body: When a user maximizes genesis, and then closes the application, genesis is supposed to remember that setting and make the window maximized on startup. However this is not possible because GLFW does not support maximization yet: https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/266

issue.title: Make the window auxiliary

milestone.title: None
milestone.description: This is for issues that do not belong to any milestone, to tell them apart from un-reviewed issues closed by the submitter.

repository.name: glfw

issue.body: As OSX fullscreen (by pressing the green button) is not supported by GLFW (windowDidEnterFullScreen: and windowDidExitFullScreen: callbacks), I suggest making the GLFW window auxiliary (that forbids user to enter the fullscreen manually) and allow entering fullscreen only programmatically (as it is on other platforms).

body:
Moving this to 3.3 because I want to put out a release including Vulkan support as soon as possible.

The blocking issues for this feature are:
- [x] Should it use zoom or Lion full screen on OS X?
- [x] Is it possible to have a newly created window enter this state before being shown?
- [x] Should un-maximization be done with `glfwRestoreWindow` or a new function?
- [x] Should there be an event callback?

> Should it use zoom or Lion full screen on OS X?

I think they are 2 separate modes.

Zoom is most like the Windows maximize. Lion full screen is more like a way of switching to a borderless fullscreen window (Windows has no equivalent way for users to do this with standard UI).
@shurcooL True, but Lion full screen is what currently happens when you click the analog of the maximization button for GLFW windows and many other OS X applications.

> but Lion full screen is what currently happens when you click the analog of the maximization button for GLFW windows and many other OS X applications.

Yeah. It's still possible to have the old zoom behavior by Option-Clicking (holding Option/Alt key, then Left Clicking with mouse), or by using the Window->Zoom menu item. But a normal click is now indeed mapped to entering fullscreen.

There's no perfect mapping to Windows.
All right, zoom it is then.
One item remaining. Unless someone objects I'll go with the results of [this poll](https://twitter.com/elmindreda/status/677125720410357760).
